intro: Lopezia coronata, commonly known as the crownflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Lopezia coronata is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
